base_note.note_text:
EBUS PROCEDURE NOTE
Date: 2025-10-11
Patient: Robert Garcia | MRN: 4906580 | Age: 71M
Attending: Dr. Christine Lee, MD
Cytopathologist: Dr. Mark Thompson, MD
Location: Memorial Sloan Kettering, New York, NY

INDICATION: 71M with 3.5cm RUL mass (SUV 12), PET-positive mediastinal nodes (4R, 7). EBUS for staging prior to treatment planning.

PROCEDURE: EBUS-TBNA

ANESTHESIA: Moderate sedation

RESULTS:

Station 4R (Right lower paratracheal):
- 20mm, heterogeneous, no CHS
- 4 passes with 22G needle
- ROSE: POSITIVE - Adenocarcinoma

Station 7 (Subcarinal):
- 24mm, round, heterogeneous
- 4 passes
- ROSE: POSITIVE - Adenocarcinoma

Station 11R (Right interlobar):
- 12mm
- 3 passes
- ROSE: POSITIVE - Adenocarcinoma

Specimens sent for cell block, molecular testing (EGFR, ALK, ROS1, PD-L1).

IMPRESSION: EBUS-TBNA confirms metastatic adenocarcinoma at stations 4R, 7, 11R. Pathologic N2 disease. Stage IIIA (cT2aN2M0).

PLAN: Medical oncology referral for concurrent chemoradiation.

Dr. Christine Lee, MD

code_rationales.31653: EBUS-TBNA 3+ stations for lung cancer staging. N2 disease confirmed.

coding_review.overall_assessment: EBUS-TBNA positive at all stations confirming stage IIIA N2 disease.

cpt_codes.description: Bronchoscopy; with EBUS sampling, 3 or more nodal stations

changes: Populated registry_entry.billing from ip_coding_billing.v2_7 for CPT codes 31653; total_work_rvu=4.96, total_rvu=7.7 (facility).

variations.note_text:
INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY PROCEDURE DOCUMENTATION
============================================================

PATIENT IDENTIFICATION AND DEMOGRAPHICS
----------------------------------------
Patient: Gloria Anderson
Medical Record Number: 1617687
Date of Birth: N/A
Age at Procedure: N/A years
Procedure Date: 2025-09-17

CLINICAL INDICATION AND PREOPERATIVE ASSESSMENT
----------------------------------------
The patient presented with rul mass staging. Following comprehensive multidisciplinary evaluation and informed consent discussion detailing procedural risks, benefits, and alternatives, the patient elected to proceed with the proposed intervention.

PROCEDURAL METHODOLOGY AND TECHNIQUE
----------------------------------------

Linear Ebus:
Endobronchial ultrasound-guided transbronchial needle aspiration was performed utilizing real-time sonographic guidance for precise lymph node targeting. Systematic sampling was conducted at stations 4R, 7, 11R. Rapid on-site cytological evaluation was employed to ensure specimen adequacy. 

INTRAPROCEDURAL FINDINGS
----------------------------------------
Detailed airway examination was performed with findings as documented in the procedural narrative.


POSTPROCEDURAL ASSESSMENT AND DISPOSITION
----------------------------------------
The procedure was completed without immediate complications. The patient demonstrated hemodynamic stability throughout and was transferred to the recovery area in satisfactory condition.

PROCEDURAL CODING DOCUMENTATION
----------------------------------------
Current Procedural Terminology Codes: 31653

This documentation has been prepared in accordance with institutional standards for procedural documentation and coding compliance.

code_rationales.31653: EBUS-TBNA 3+ stations for lung cancer staging. N2 disease confirmed.

PROCEDURE NOTE

Date: 2024-12-14
Patient: James Foster
MRN: 7764673
Age/Sex: Noneyo patient

Attending Physician: [Attending]
Resident/Fellow: [Trainee, PGY-X]

INDICATION:
RUL mass staging

CONSENT:
Informed consent obtained. Risks, benefits, and alternatives discussed.
Patient verbalized understanding and agreed to proceed.

TIMEOUT:
Performed. Correct patient, procedure, and site confirmed.

SEDATION:
Moderate

PROCEDURE STEPS:
1. Patient positioned and monitored
2. Sedation administered per protocol
3. Topical anesthesia applied to airway
4. Linear Ebus performed
5. Scope withdrawn
6. Patient recovered without complication

SPECIMENS:
sent for cell block, molecular testing (EGFR, ALK, ROS1, PD-L1).

COMPLICATIONS:
None

EBL:
Minimal

DISPOSITION:
To recovery, stable condition

CPT CODES: 31653

ATTESTATION:
I was present for the entire procedure and agree with the above documentation.
[Attending Signature]

variations.note_text:
On 2025-10-20, Kyle Wood, a None-year-old patient (MRN 7092108), underwent bronchoscopic evaluation for RUL mass staging. The patient received Moderate and the procedure was performed in standard fashion. The procedure included endobronchial ultrasound-guided sampling of lymph node stations 4R, 7, 11R with rapid on-site evaluation. 

On examination, the airways were systematically inspected. Abnormal findings were noted as described in detail above. The procedure was completed without immediate complications. 

The patient tolerated the procedure well and was transferred to the recovery area in stable condition. Specimens obtained were sent for appropriate analysis and results will be reviewed at follow-up. The preliminary assessment is adenocarcinoma - n2 disease. 

Procedural coding: 31653.
